subject: Public Speaking
title: Social Proof in Speeches
description: A micro-lesson that makes Social Proof in Speeches usable.

hook.text: If everyone's applauding, you will too. That's social proof.

buildup.text: Mentioning how many people agree increases persuasive power.

discovery.text: Audiences follow the crowd. We're wired for conformity.

twist.text: Use testimonials, statistics, and examples of others taking action.

climax.text: Social proof is most powerful when the group is relatable.

punchline.text: Show others agree. Audiences follow crowds.

quiz.question: What is social proof?
options: People conforming to what others do
